channel.title: [new model] need help modeling a part!
channel.description:
Hey again guys heres a 3 day project Im near to finishing :D But theres just 1 part I cant get take a look! [img]http://i347.photobucket.com/albums/p460/frogtamer101/NEWWEAPON.jpg[/img]
Now what I need is where the handel meets the blade particularly the flames. Should I just outline it with lines then create faes then make a copy and scale that one up then make the faces so its a little rounded. Im clueless and stumped! HELP ME :D [img]http://images.buycostumes.com/mgen/merchandiser/18403.jpg[/img]

item.title: [new model] need help modeling a part!
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

They are basic ways of doing it. But they do come out quite nicely

item.title: [new model] need help modeling a part!
item.dc:creator: @Assassins_Creed_Fan Assassins Creed Fan
item.description:
@Assassins_Creed_Fan wrote:

What jjones10 said,
Another way to do it is just to create the faces, Edit-> Select all
Selected-> Double Sided Faces
Edit-> Select All
Selected-> Extrude Faces, and then make it like 2-3 instead of 10
(Make sure that you only select the flames and not the whole model.)

Read full topic

item.title: [new model] need help modeling a part!
item.dc:creator: @jjones10 jjones10
item.description:
@jjones10 wrote:

Outline the layers on the model. create the faces with the color you want. then lift the face off the model.
